name: The Noble Grape Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a Malaysian ,travel with my boyfriend, he's the one made a good choices to stayed at Noble Grape, I have so much to say during our stay for 3D2N, its really awesome by Rod & Donna, they're both very friendly, I beleived in Cowaramup country side people much nicer to be around.
reviews.title: The friendly ever..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definetly to come back again, and your breakfast treat its awesome especially your homemade muffin..I missed them already:-)
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Strongly recomended for others...Fizah
reviews.title: Very comfortable B&B in pretty gardens with very friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent B&B...with beautiful rose cottage gardens. Close location to Margaret River, and dispite being on the main highway and traffic during the night did not bother us at all...More then adequate space in your room and the facilities were brilliant. Attention to details was very good and the hosts Ron and Donna were attentive but not intrusive. What a comfy king size bed with electric under blanket, so cosy and warm...free internet, out door barbecue available...we stayed only one night and wished it could have been for longer...thanks to Ron's home made muffins which were amazing making the breakfast experience a real treat...good luck to Donna and Rod for the future, a pleasure to have called by.....
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We chose the Noble Grape for it's good position near Margaret River and for the pretty garden setting. The room was very comfortable and spacious. Donna was very welcoming and had lots of suggestions for what to do locally. Rod's breakfast muffins were delicious as was the selection which was varied. There are a couple of restaurants locally but a good choice in Margaret River. Laundry on site as well as free internet access which worked best in the dining room. Good choice for the area and central to all attractions.
reviews.title: Girly Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two days in early March and could not have been happier. Breakfast was great and varied, the hosts very attentive and friendly. Margaret River is just a few minutes drive away, where Waves Seafood Grill was great for dinner, though it is BYOB so buy wine before going. Wi-fi internet worked great at The Noble Grape Guest House and is free, much better than the connection that I paid over $20 in Perth the previous day. If you enjoy staying at B&Bs, you will love this place. Make sure to eat plenty of those delicious muffins :)
reviews.title: Fantastic Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights when touring WA. Room was large and very comfortable, 2 large armchairs, basic cooking (microwave, kettle), free WiFi and DVD player including a selection of DVDs in room and more available.
reviews.title: Lovely place and staff comvenient for Margaret river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Run by a husband & wife who were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: more of a motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast included, and was a buffet continental in the dining room, was excellent also.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a really good place, reasonably priced and would thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Great B&B - you'll want to move in permanently.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had two nights here at the start of our trip from Perth to the South West. Extremely comfortable, clean and spacious room with own patio area. Lovely to sit in the garden early evening and watch the birds feed. Close to the main road but not noisy. Ate both evenings at a newly opened Fork and Fiz(?)BYO. Excellent food though they couldn't at that time accept credit cards which was a nuisance. Great to be close to Margaret River yet away from the loads of tourists who were around there. Visited Augusta, Cape Leuwin and the Jewel Cave, all of which were well worthwhile though for a first visit to this area you should include a guided wine tour. Beautiful coastline and countryside.
reviews.title: Luxurious B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first review which I felt compelled to write as tripadvisor led me to this wonderful B n B. Stayed 2 nights, wish it was longer. Immaculate, very comfortable room, with your own back patio area. Very comfy bed with plenty of decent pillows! It's 10 mins from M.River and many of the great wineries in the region. Beaches and other attractions a little further away but all within 1/2 hours drive. Room facilities are excellent incl microwave and dishes/cutlery if you wish to eat in. Amenities provided are exellent....even a full bar of soap, :) Nice little touches in the room to make you feel comfortable. Hosts, Donna & Rod are very friendly and helpful & address you by name and take a genuine interest in you and your holiday. They provide plenty to eat at breakfast; all healthy (which you need after indulging in the fine wines and other gourmet delights in the region) . Our personal recommendation for fine dining in the region is to lunch at at one of the wineries and eat in for dinner. We found it hard to find a decent meal in the evening from M. River through to Dunsborough but to be fair we didn't try the local one(s) in Cowaramup. The words..."guest house" is 'spot on' in the name as we truly felt like guests. Stayed 9th & 10th March 2011. Wish it was longer. Thanks Donna & Rod for a peaceful, comfy stay. We truly hope to be back.
reviews.title: BRILLIANT B AND B IN IDEAL LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in a spacious King room which was nicely decorated and had a very comfortable bed. Great hosts Donna & Rod could not have been accommodating and laid on a lovely spread for breakfast in the large dining area. In the evening it was nice to sit out in the pleasant gardens and have a drink of wine (bought from one of the local wineries) and chat to the other guests, Donna & Rod even supplied a BBQ. The Noble Grape is a good place to stay if you want to visit the wineries, Bunker Bay or Busselton.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B Great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended we would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Pretty place in a tiny town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything we needed - huge room and bathroom, pretty garden and good breakfasts, The hosts were very helpful indeed. There's not much in Cowaramup but there is a restaurant and it's very close to Margaret River. Didn't notice any traffic noise at all.
reviews.title: A great Aussie welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing you notice is how warm and friendly the hosts Rod and Donna are. They are really helpful. (They will advise you to go to the local pizza and pasta place Pinocchios)
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay, great base for touring the wineries, great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were warm and comfy. It feels new and modern, yet it has a lot of charm. A very homely feeling. The electric blankets really made for a nice winter sleep.
reviews.title: Friendly Hosts n Lovely Guesthouse with Homely Little Details for Guest Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The gardens are beautiful. It all adds up to make it the cutest guest house
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great for touring the wineries and other attractions in the region.
reviews.title: it was a lovely stay with helpful & obliging hosts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the only thing missing was the option of a hot breakfast as they only do a continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Delightful

aka: The Noble Grape Guest House Margaret River Region/Cowaramup, Australia
description: Just short of Margaret River you pass through Cowaramup, a quiet town with the distinction of being closer to most of the Margaret River vineyards than Margaret River itself. The Noble Grape offers warm, friendly quality and affordable accommodation in the heart of the Margaret River wine region of Western Australia.
